headline: Texas Twinkies
description: Bacon-wrapped jalapeño poppers, stuffed with cream cheese and leftover beef brisket are served smothered in BBQ sauce for a crowd-pleasing snack.
name: Texas Twinkies
recipeIngredient: kosher salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).

Slice jalapeños in the shape of a "T." Cut a straight vertical line from top to bottom with a crosscut directly under the stem, making sure to cut only halfway through the jalapeños. Use a spoon to remove and discard all seeds and membranes. Place jalapeños on a baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes.
Transfer jalapeños to a bowl of ice water for a few minutes to extract the rest of the seeds' oil. Blot dry with a paper towel.
Increase oven temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Spread 1 tablespoon cream cheese inside each jalapeño. Place about 2 ounces brisket inside each, then wrap with a slice of bacon. Place poppers on a baking sheet and season with salt and pepper.
Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes. Remove from the oven and brush the tops with BBQ sauce. Return to the oven and bake 5 more minutes.

review.reviewBody: Not having and brisket, I thinly sliced and grilled round steak, used some for this recipe for my husband and the rest for a nice steak salad for myself. Hubby raved about them!!!

Good recipe, but I couldn’t find “left over brisket”. There appears to be no such thing on this planet ?? that being said, I bought a container of brisket and added my normal seasoning for brisket and used that. Also I used a spicy BBQ sauce available here in SC
They were good, but not special.

I've made a recipe that's the same as this one for year's, the only difference is this one is baked not smoked. FYI the 
1 1/2 Lb is cooked/smoked brisket.
These were very good. I added 1 tsp of garlic powder and 1/2 tsp of cayenne pepper to the softened cream cheese.
